history.proof: hauto depth: 2 lq: on exh: on use: regular_l unfold: opposite, is_opposite, is_group.

exceptions.tactic: intros S G Add O Opp is_group x HG.
intros S' G Add O Opp is_group x HG.
intros S' G' Add O Opp is_group x HG.
intros S' G' Add' O Opp is_group x HG.
intros S' G' Add' O' Opp is_group x HG.
intros S' G' Add' O' Opp' is_group x HG.
assert (is_opposite S G Add O x (Opp (Opp x))) as H by (unfold is_opposite; split; [apply HG | split; [apply opp_unicity | unfold Opp]]).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
G: S -> Prop
Add: S -> S -> S
O: S
Opp: S -> S

Goal:
is_group -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)

Premises:
is_group = intern S G Add /\ associativity S Add /\ neutral S G Add O /\ opposite S G Add O Opp : Prop
opp_unicity : is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
projT2_of_sigT2_eq : forall p : ?u = ?v, eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?u)) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?v)) (projT1_of_sigT2_eq p) = projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?v) where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?P : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A -> Type] ?Q : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A -> Type] ?u : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S ->...-> S |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}]
VectorDef.take : forall p : nat, p <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?n : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- nat]
rew_sig : forall (Q : forall a : ?A, ?P a -> Prop) (u : {p : ?P ?x | Q ?x p}) (y : ?A) (H : ?x = y), eq_rect ?x (fun a : ?A => {p : ?P a | Q a p}) u y H = exist (Q y) (eq_rect ?x ?P (proj1_sig u) y H) match H as x in (_ = a) return (Q a (eq_rect ?x ?P (proj1_sig u) a x)) with | eq_refl => proj2_sig u end where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?x : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A] ?P : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A -> Type]
VectorSpec.take_app : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (m : nat) (w : VectorDef.t ?A m) (le : ?n <= ?n + m), VectorDef.take ?n le (VectorDef.append v w) = v where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?n : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- nat]
eq_sigT2_uncurried : forall u v : {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}, {p : projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u) = projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v) & eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 v) & eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?Q a) (projT3 u) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT3 v} -> u = v where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?P : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A ->...-> Type]
eq_sigT2_uncurried_iff : forall u v : {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}, u = v < -> {p : projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u) = projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v) & eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 v) & eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?Q a) (projT3 u) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT3 v} where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?P : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A ->...-> Type]
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
regular_l : is_group -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
ZifyClasses.mkbrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : ZifyClasses.InjTyp S T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (ZifyClasses.inj n) (ZifyClasses.inj m)) -> ZifyClasses.BinRel R
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Record BinRel (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : ZifyClasses.InjTyp S T) : Type := mkbrel { TR : T -> T -> Prop; TRInj : forall n m : S, R n m < -> TR (ZifyClasses.inj n) (ZifyClasses.inj m) } BinRel has primitive projections with eta conversion. Arguments ZifyClasses.BinRel {S T}%type_scope _%function_scope {I} Arguments ZifyClasses.mkbrel (_ _)%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%function_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_ind : forall (a b g : BinNums.Z) (P : Prop), (BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> P) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Ring_theory.SRIDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
Ring_theory.mkmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y))) ->...-> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi
existT2 : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> Q x -> {x : A & P x & Q x}
BinInt.Z.compare_eq : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.compare x y = Eq -> x = y
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall...
BinPos.Pos.gt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.gt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
Inductive sigT2 (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type) : Type := existT2 : forall x : A, P x -> Q x -> {x : A & P x & Q x} Arguments sigT2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%type_scope Arguments existT2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
Eqdep_dec.eq_proofs_unicity : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (x y : A) (p1 p2 : x = y), p1 = p2
EqdepFacts.UIP_shift_on : forall (X : Type) (x : X), EqdepFacts.UIP_refl_on_ X x -> forall y : x = x, EqdepFacts.UIP_refl_on_ (x = x) y
Eqdep_dec.eq_proofs_unicity_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (y : A) (p1 p2 : x = y), p1 = p2
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Nnat.N2Nat.inj_iter : forall (a : BinNums.N) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (x : A), BinNat.N.iter a f x = PeanoNat.Nat.iter (BinNat.N.to_nat a) f x

```coq
intros S G Add O Opp is_group x HG. assert (is_opposite S G Add O x (Opp (Opp x))) as H by (unfold is_opposite; split; [exact HG | split; [apply opp_unicity | unfold Opp]]).
apply projT2_of_sigT2_eq in H. rewrite H. clear H. apply eq_sigT2_uncurried_iff. split; [reflexivity | split; reflexivity].
Qed.```

original: intros S G Add O Opp is_group x HG. assert (is_opposite S G Add O x (Opp (Opp x))) as H by (unfold is_opposite; split; [apply HG | split; [apply opp_unicity | unfold Opp]]). apply projT2_of_sigT2_eq in H. rewrite H. clear H. apply eq_sigT2_uncurried_iff. split; [reflexivity | split; reflexivity].
